comments:
Using 2.0 everything works fine. Using the Update-Option of Eclipse I updated 
to 2.0.1

After installation and restarting, the perspective "CVS Repository Exploring" 
was visiblie in on the left side, but when selected, the main window showed 
nothing.

Then I closed this perspective and tried to re-open it.
Every possible way to open the "CVS Repository Exploring"-perspective had no 
effects.

Is there any information in your /workspace/.metadata/.log file?
Are you able to perform any Team/VCM actions?

Created an attachment (id=2033)
Menu for Team/Synchronize with Repository is availiable, but does not work
Note: see stack traces at bottom of log file.

Wow, that's one messed up install.

The simple answer is that the action is failing because the plugin won't start 
due to a missing method (but why is it missing?).

But there are tons of errors before that:

- a whole slew from JDT/search, it appears from the times that these occured on 
startup

- them another session with a bunch of the form:
"!ENTRY org.eclipse.help 4 0 Jun 04, 2002 18:35:18.574
!MESSAGE Document /org.eclipse.jdt.doc.user/concepts/cclsspthv.htm cannot be 
read."

- missing .project files:
"!MESSAGE Problems occurred while restoring the workspace.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 567 Jun 05, 2002 13:11:51.470
!MESSAGE The project description file (.project) for SDS2 is missing.  This 
file contains important information about the project.  The project will not 
function properly until this file is restored."

- platform metadata already in use:
"The platform metadata area is already in use by another platform instance, or 
there was a failure
in deleting the old lock file.  If no other platform instances are running, 
delete the 
lock file (D:\Programme\eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.lock) and try starting the 
platform again."

Q: Are you perhaps trying to run two workspaces off of the same workspace data?

- then, some team CVS assertion failures which I can't interpert how you got in 
that state.

- then, the plugin loading problem and failure reported

- just to add to the fun, you're using CVSNT which we don't support.

Because of all these previous errors I have to assume that there's something 
wrong with your install, and your workspace may even be corrupt (either prior, 
or as a result of trying to work with it in this state).

You are going to have to figure out what you did. 

I've just installed a 2.0 and updraded it via install to 2.0.1.  I was able to 
open the CVS perspective without problem, and perform other CVS operations.

Without further information its not clear where to start (no action possible).  
The set of errors previous to the Team errors suggests its not a Team CVS bug, 
but it could remotely be Update.  I have to assume that the steps performed by 
the user were more than is described in the bug report.  Repeatable detailed 
steps would help.

I am going to move it to Update on the off chance they've seen similar, with 
the only other choice being to close it as invalid.

OK, I should say, that I use CVSNT!

And I had several problems to keep Eclipse runnig with that. The main problem
was, that it was difficult to add a CVS-Module as a Project. After some strange
Workarounds it was possible.

If CVSNT is the main problem, where is this Information been pronounced?

Well my workaround was something like that:
I had a CVS-directory created by WinCVS. Create/New project with the
CVS-directory as it's directory. Eclipse then tells you that there is something
CVS-like and if it should use the infos. I tell him to do so. After that, CVS
did work.

Answer to your question, if i run two workspaces the same time: No

After removing the 
D:\Programme\eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.lock
it was not possible anymore to start Eclipse (deadlook)
.lock was created several seconds than remove again.

OK, maybe you should close this Bug, if all Problems have been messed up by CVSNT.

I will reinstall Eclipse now.
If you still think the problem was caused by CVSNT, please close the defect.
